contest-event.event-date:
Aug. 31, 1863 D Belle Vue Brass Band Contest
British Open 1 Test Piece Contest
british-open
Set Test and Own Choice
Faust [Gounod, unknown arranger]
Belle Vue, Manchester, Greater Manchester, England, UK 'Own Choice' plus Faust, Gounod Prizes: 1st: £30 2nd: £14 3rd: £7 4th: £4.10 5th: £2. A discrepency in bands occurs - Derek Rawlinson in his book shows Foxhill conductor S.Bentley, whilst British Bandsman 10/8/1963 shows a band called Scholes near Cleckheaton as conducted by Samuel Bentley.
April 12, 2011, 10:16 p.m. Aug. 22, 2016, 10:20 a.m.
1 Black Dyke Band Frank Galloway
2 Bacup Old John Lord
3 Craven Amateur (Silsden) G. O'Brien
4 Preston (11th L.R.V) Jasper Norwood
5 Dewsbury Band John Peel
Unknown Result Foxhill Bank Accrington Samuel Bentley
Unknown Result Compstall Band Henry Tymm
Unknown Result Delph Band William Hudson
